observations.topic: AI-native vendor clustering in DKIM signals
observations.observation: Five of the nine DKIM vendors detected are directly tied to OpenAI or AI-adjacent platforms (OpenAI, tm1.openai.com, email.openai.com, Anthropic, Suno), suggesting the user base skews heavily toward early adopters of AI tools — a demographic signal that could inform targeting and partnership strategies.

observations.topic: Unknown category dominance in high-value spend
observations.observation: The 'Unknown' category represents only 145 of 1,395 receipts (10%) in the 14-day window but accounts for $17,228 — an average of $118.81 per receipt versus $51.35 for grocery and $31.57 for restaurants — indicating a concentration of high-value transactions that are not yet categorized and warrant closer classification.

The platform has crossed $197K cumulative GMV across 3,392 receipts, with the 14-day window alone accounting for $79,603 (40% of all-time GMV), suggesting the user base is either very new or experiencing a sharp acceleration in recent activity.
A modest increase of $23.49 in 14-day GMV and 1 additional receipt suggests steady, incremental growth in transaction volume and value over the two-week period.

observations.topic: 7-day GMV and spend count incremental growth
observations.observation: The 7-day GMV increased marginally by $4.72 alongside a single additional receipt, indicating a stable but very slight increase in transaction value and frequency.

observations.topic: Consistent spend count and GMV ratios
observations.observation: Across cumulative, 7-day, and 14-day windows, the proportional increases in spend counts and GMV remain aligned, indicating stable average transaction sizes without major fluctuations in purchase behavior recently.

observations.topic: Incremental GMV and spend count growth
observations.observation: Small but steady increases in total GMV (+$36.87) and spend count (+2 receipts) suggest a continued modest upward trend in overall transaction volume and value.
The addition of CBSA 22220 as a new metro area indicates expanding geographic coverage, which may lead to new regional commerce insights and influence future spending patterns in this area.

observations.topic: Receipt count growth outpaces GMV increase
observations.observation: The total spend count rose by 9 receipts (0.27%) while GMV increased by only $212.64 (0.11%), indicating smaller average transaction sizes or more frequent low-value purchases in the latest period.

The addition of five new metro areas, including CBSA 38060, 39150, 22380, and non-metro areas US-PA and US-AZ, suggests expansion in geographic coverage or data granularity, which could impact regional commerce insights.
